_source.Subject: support for ESD and latch up DRC
which process is integrated with 15kV esd cell?
_source.Description: Request on X-FAB process which includes 15KV ESD cell
_source.Support: X-FAB I/O Cells are for component level ESD, For system level ESD, recommended XC06, available to modify SCR clamps to meet customer's spec.

_source.Subject: Calibre PERC runsets
_source.Description:
Customer is looking for Calibre PERC runset as they are doing multi voltage design errors and 
ESD failures
_source.Support: Calibre PERC runsets is not offered, however customer is recommended to use ESD design checker utility as an alternative solution.

_source.Subject: possibility to transfer analog IP between XT018 and XT018
_source.Support:
Yes there is some compatibility between the XH018 and XT018 processes.
The fastest transfer: the analog library created in one process setup, and open it under the other process setup.

Check that the primitive devices used also exist in the other process. If certain devices do not exist, they have to be deleted from the circuit and replaced with the and replace them with the corresponding counterpart from the other process.
A new circuit verification (simulation) and layout verification (DRC, LVS) is recommended.
is recommended.

_source.Subject: Off-Grid discrepancies detected in XT018
_source.Description:
Request to replicate off-grid error detected. Melexis would like to have an access to rule deck
used by X-Fab to validate off-grid errors
_source.Support: This rule is developed by MaskTooling team. The team is working on standardisation and harmonisation of the off-grid check and no timeline is specify until when this objective will be achieved.

_source.Subject: noise comparison for baseline mos devices between xc018 and xt018 to faciliate possibility of design migration
design challenge for 90V push pull stage driver with 14V supply and very steep transient
_source.Support: We intend to use the NBUR to isolate the high side from the current spikes caused by the handle wafer. This will mean to waive several DRC errors. In the long run I will try to convince the team for the next xt018 release (r11) to allow certain elements on NBUR to make full reign of the capabilities of xt018 - (Usage of NBUR in xt018. For mos half bridge driver which control voltage can be up to 20 V it would be beneficial to have some HV devices isolated by NBUR. We identified candidates and will allow some more devices with r11.)

_source.Subject: support of Inductor device
_source.Support:
we don't have any inductors in XT018. I suppose you could
develop your own, but we would not be able to support you (pdk, drc, lvs,
extract, model, characterisation, reliability tests etc).

We do have inductors in some other technologies (XH035, XR013 etc), but these
are quite different platforms, so a translation of design would not be
trivial.

_source.Subject: intend to create pwell-hvnwell photodiode for high response at 430nm and low capacitance
_source.Support:
propose to use the p-Zehner implant (PZN) as anode and to implement the cathode either with a NBD or DFN well. I am no expert on XT018 layout, so I cannot recommend how to draw this. For very low reverse bias, the NBD will offer likely the lower capacitance, whereas for normal to higher reverse bias, the DFN would offer the lower junction capacity.
 
DFN requires the NHVR or PHVR module (HVMOS N-drift implant gds 292)
NBD requires the HVN module (HVNWELL gds 87)
PZN requires the DIODEB module (PZEHNER gds 209)

PWell is no good choice as the doping profile will prevent a good blue response.

_source.Customer: Institute of Microelectronics Chinese academy of Science
_source.Subject: looking for doping concentration of handle wafer
_source.Support: We do not specify the doping density of the XT018 handle wafer, but we do specify the resistivity - please see SpecXplorer, or the Process and Device Specification document and search for parameter RSWAFHW. You may be able to conclude something about the doping concentration from that resistivity value
